channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Potential disruption for NI passengers over Airbus modifications
item.description: Belfast International airport says passengers should check with their airline for the latest flight information.

item.title: Residents and businesses hope for a return to normal as road set to reopen
item.description: Transport operator Translink has said Durham Street will reopen at 08:00 GMT on Saturday.

item.title: Romanian teens accused of rape attempt that sparked riots have charges dropped
item.description: The boys, aged 14 and 15, have been in custody since the alleged assault on 7 June which led to race riots across NI.

item.title: Serious two vehicle crash near Enniskillen
item.description: The crash happened on the Derrylin Road, which is closed at its junction with the Tiravally Road.

item.title: Second man charged after assaults on police officers
item.description: A 21-year-old man has been charged with a number of offences which include attempted murder.

item.title: Homes evacuated after suspicious object found
item.description: Cordons are in place at Areema Drive in Twinbrook as police ask people to avoid the area.

item.title: Teacher has jail term revoked for sex assault on child
item.description: A former music teacher at Erne Integrated College had his appeal against his sentence upheld.

item.title: Ulster secure bonus-point win over Benetton in URC
item.description: Ulster return to winning ways in the United Rugby Championship by beating Benetton 47-13 at the Affidea Stadium.

item.title: 'I'll definitely use the new late night transport' as scheme launches
item.description: An extended timetable of late night bus and rail services in Northern Ireland begins on Friday night.

item.title: Internet 'catfish' sentenced for abuse of schoolgirls
item.description: Tommy Reader admitted a total of 33 offences including inciting a child to engage in sexual activity and blackmail

item.title: Schools told to continue providing RE based on 'holy scriptures'
item.description: Paul Givan's letter follows a court judgement that the Christian focused RE taught in Northern Ireland was unlawful.

item.title: 'Callous' beheading of stag prompts police investigation
item.description: The headless body of the stag, that was part of the herd at Newbridge Demesne in Dublin, was found by staff on Thursday.

item.title: Son given life sentence for murdering his 75-year-old mother
item.description: Miriam Burns died from asphyxia due to manual strangulation along with blunt force trauma to her head.

item.title: Man released over suspected 'drugs menu' posted in kids football coach chat
item.description: The 31-year-old was arrested in west Belfast on Thursday in relation to alleged illegal drug supply.

item.title: Benefit fraud in Northern Ireland rises to £233m, says minister
item.description: The communities minister is pushing for a crackdown on benefit fraud as the Treasury allows NI to keep some of the savings.

item.title: Man jailed over murder of 'gentle, innocent' Irish man carrying his shopping
item.description: John Mackey, 87, was punched and stamped on after going shopping for groceries in north London.

item.title: Windsor Park on 2035 World Cup stadium list
item.description: Manchester United's proposed new Old Trafford stadium is one of 22 venues named in the UK's bid to host the 2035 Women's World Cup.

item.title: Belfast's Elle Vosque is runner up in Drag Race UK final
item.description: Elle appeared in the final alongside Silllexa Dixon, Catrin Feelings and the series winner Bones.

item.title: Cross border electric car drivers ask for EV tax 'detail'
item.description: The chair of the Electric Vehicle Association of Northern Ireland says the new tax is "really premature".

item.title: NI schools were closed during storm without ministerial approval
item.description: Schools were closed during Storm Amy without prior approval from the Education Minister Paul Givan or officials.

item.title: Armagh to face Tyrone in Ulster Championship opener
item.description: Armagh will face Tyrone in the preliminary round of the 2026 Ulster Championship, while holders Donegal are potential semi-final opponents.

item.title: 'Serious risks' to animal and public health after post-Brexit grace period
item.description: A grace period for existing measures expires on 31 December.

item.title: Extra money for NI not 'meeting the demand', says minister
item.description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves announced an extra £370m for Northern Ireland in the Autumn Budget on Wednesday.

item.title: 'I've been punched and spat at by customers'
item.description: More plain clothed and uniformed officers will be visible across towns and cities in NI during the Christmas period.

item.title: Family court system 'scary' and 'not fit for purpose', say parents
item.description: Family courts make thousands of rulings in NI every year on issues such as adoption, divorce and child custody.

item.title: Mum travels 80 miles to take her son to 'priceless' cerebral palsy school
item.description: The Buddy Bear School in Dungannon, County Tyrone, opened in 1993 and is the only school of its kind in Northern Ireland.

item.title: The 'sting' of having all your work tools stolen
item.description: In 2023/24 the Police Service of Northern Ireland (PSNI) recorded 327 incidents of tools being stolen in Northern Ireland.

item.title: What revenue-raising options could be on the table for NI?
item.description: "Revenue raising" has been mentioned by NI's Secretary of State - but what options are on the table?

item.title: BBC Newsline signed summary
item.description: A signed summary of BBC Newsline.

item.title: 'We work hard, you want to get the best out of it' - Budget minimum wage rise welcomed
item.description: With rising costs in recent years, a mum-of-four tells BBC News NI she thinks about household finances constantly.

item.title: Sudanese family says racist graffiti will not force them to leave home
item.description: The words 'local only' were daubed on Hala Ahmed's family home in Londonderry's Fountain estate.

item.title: Grid charge changes set to make going green easier
item.description: Consumers and businesses will pay for the kit needed to connect their own property and any grid reinforcement will become a social charge.

item.title: How a 'hero' dog's bark saved her owner's life
item.description: A four-year-old golden retriever from County Fermanagh is being honoured as a "CPR hero" in London.

item.title: Elderly man 'broken' after losing £35k in online scams
item.description: Eddie Rushe, aged 82 from Lurgan, fell victim to three separate scams over 18 months.

item.title: 'Anguish and pain' for parents of kidnapped children, says Irish nun
item.description: The raid on a Catholic school came amid a surge of attacks by armed groups in the West African nation.

item.title: Council votes to change street named after former prince
item.description: Councillors in Mid and East Antrim have voted to change the name of a road called Prince Andrew Way in Carrickfergus.

item.title: Hospital staff ask deaf couple, 'What is a BSL interpreter?'
item.description: A health trust apologises to a deaf couple for the distress caused after they were left without a British Sign Language interpreter.

item.title: Titanic passenger's watch fetches record price at auction
item.description: The watch belonged to the American businessman Isidor Straus, who died alongside his wife in the disaster.

item.title: Special needs school pupils at home due to mouldy classrooms
item.description: More than 30 pupils at Sandelford Special School in Coleraine are facing remote learning due to health and safety issues.

item.title: No All Blacks without Donegal man who died at Passchendaele
item.description: The legacy of Dave Gallaher, the Irish-born All Blacks captain, has been remembered in County Donegal.

item.title: Pope Leo's 'great catch' as gaelic football jersey lobbed at him
item.description: The pontiff caught a special ‘Leo 14′ jersey thrown to him by Tyrone TV producer Aidan Gallagher.

item.title: Was Oxtoby's Northern Ireland tenure a success?
item.description: After it was announced she would leave Northern Ireland to join Newcastle United, was Tanya Oxtoby's tenure as manager a success?

item.title: Easter parade trial shown 'join the IRA' video
item.description: The four men - Thomas Ashe Mellon, Jason Lee Ceulemans, Patrick Anthony Gallagher and Stephen Martin Murney - deny the charges.

item.title: Attempted murder arrest after officer stabbed with hunting knife
item.description: Deputy Chief Constable Bobby Singleton said the attack highlights the risks many police officers face on a day-to-day basis.

item.title: Walled city's heritage brought to life in new 3D map
item.description: Using state-of-the-art scanning technology, Derry's historic walls have been recreated in a 3D map.

item.title: Seized pipe bombs contained ball bearings - trial told
item.description: The details were given at the trial of four men who deny charges linked to a dissident republican parade in Derry in 2023.

item.title: Trial begins for four accused over Derry Easter parade
item.description: The four men - Thomas Ashe Mellon, Jason Lee Ceulemans, Patrick Anthony Gallagher and Stephen Martin Murney - deny the charges.

item.title: Men jailed over unprovoked attack on drunk friend
item.description: Kieran Kelly and Dylan Quaile were both jailed for an unprovoked attack on a friend in September 2024

item.title: Drug-dealer jailed for role in organised crime gang
item.description: Jack Terence Boyd, 28, with an address at Maghaberry Prison, will spend two years in jail and two more on licence.

item.title: Remembering the five rail workers killed by train
item.description: A service will be held to remember five railway workers killed after being struck by a passenger train as they carried out maintenance work.

item.title: Sycamore Gap sapling planted in honour of Strabane man
item.description: The sapling was planted in Strabane as part of the National Trust's Trees of Hope project.

item.title: Woman's death caused by wheel bearing failure, inquest told
item.description: Shauna McDevitt, a 47-year-old mother of one, died after the incident near Toomebridge on 10 April 2022.

item.title: Prosecution spent more than £350k on barrister fees in Soldier F case
item.description: Soldier F was found not guilty of murder and attempted murder in Londonderry on Bloody Sunday at a trial in October.

item.title: Police release name of van-driver who died in crash
item.description: The collision between a van and lorry happened on the Windyhill Road at about 09:45 GMT on Thursday.

item.title: Security alert ends after several homes evacuated
item.description: A number of people were asked to leave their homes in the Glenabbey Close area of Derry on Thursday.

item.title: Derry flights and Newry theatre get a share of €50m Dublin funding
item.description: The Irish government announces funding for a flight between Londonderry and Dublin and money for a Newry theatre.

item.title: New cemetery on target for burials as old site nears full capacity
item.description: The 30-acre Mullenan City Cemetery will provide an additional 3,500 burial sites for the area.

item.title: Body-worn camera trial as hospital staff spat at and burnt with cigarettes
item.description: The Western Health and Social Care Trust says abuse of staff has increased by 27% over the last two years.

item.title: Nine police officers injured in 'appalling' assaults
item.description: Officers were punched, bitten, spat on and kicked in four separate incidents in Strabane and Derry.

item.title: Man sustains serious injuries in single-vehicle crash
item.description: A man was arrested at the scene of the crash on the Barony Road, between Omagh and Cookstown, on Sunday night.

item.title: One person injured in city centre fight
item.description: The police say a large group of young people were involved in clashes in Derry city centre in the early hours of Sunday.

item.title: Wrong anthem played at Republic of Ireland game
item.description: The Republic of Ireland's players sung an a cappella version of the national anthem after God Save the King was played by mistake ahead of a Women's Under-19 European qualifier.

item.title: 'Significant' number of asylum seekers in Ireland coming from NI
item.description: Jim O'Callaghan says almost 90% of those seeking international protection in the Republic have come from Northern Ireland.

item.title: Woman in critical condition after being set on fire
item.description: The woman was removed from the scene to hospital to be treated for burn injuries which are believed to be serious.

item.title: Irish school teacher Enoch Burke arrested and brought to prison
item.description: An Garda Síochána (Irish police) confirmed that they executed a High Court order in Mullingar, County Westmeath on Tuesday.

item.title: Bus Éireann CEO 'devastated' following crash deaths
item.description: The crash involving three vehicles happened on the R132 in Gormanston, County Meath, on Monday morning.

item.title: Man found guilty of murdering his 75-year-old mother
item.description: Miriam Burns died from asphyxia due to manual strangulation along with blunt force trauma to her head.

item.title: Irish fashion designer Paul Costelloe dies aged 80
item.description: His family issued a statement on Saturday saying they are "deeply saddened to announce the passing of Paul Costelloe following a short illness".

item.title: Pilot dies in small plane crash in Republic of Ireland
item.description: The man, who was alone in the plane, was the only fatality in the incident, Irish police say.

item.title: Narwhal carcass washes ashore on County Donegal beach
item.description: A female Narwhal washed ashore in County Donegal last weekend, the Irish government has confirmed.

item.title: NI now better prepared for another pandemic, says O'Neill
item.description: The UK Covid-19 Inquiry found decision making in Northern Ireland "was chaotic, and infected by political machination".

item.title: Man jailed for 24 years for manslaughter of Irish woman in New York
item.description: Marcin Pieciak stabbed Sarah McNally 19 times.

item.title: QUB in new cross-border 'all island university' collaboration
item.description: Dundalk Institute of Technology will get university status and students will be awarded their certs through QUB.

item.title: Crewman missing off Donegal coast named by RFA
item.description: James Elliott was last seen when the RFA Tidesurge was near Tory Island, Donegal on 14 November.

item.title: Irish government approves plans to ban disposable vapes
item.description: The Republic of Ireland is set to follow Northern Ireland in banning the sale of single use vapes.

item.title: Vigils held for five young people killed in Louth crash
item.description: The vigils, at three gaelic football grounds, follow a fatal two-vehicle crash at Gibstown on Saturday.

item.title: Derry flights and Newry theatre get a share of €50m Dublin funding
item.description: The Irish government announces funding for a flight between Londonderry and Dublin and money for a Newry theatre.

item.title: Irish teacher Enoch Burke returns to prison after 'fanatical campaign'
item.description: The judge said that Mr Burke and members of his family had engaged in a "concerted attack" on the authority of the civil courts.

item.title: Woman dead and man seriously injured in stabbing
item.description: Police were called to reports of an assault at a house at Shrewsbury Downs in Ballinlough on Monday night.

item.title: 'To think we're going to school today and she won't be there'
item.description: The principal of the school where one of the young people who died in a road crash in County Louth taught says she was a "master of her craft".

item.title: Search for missing naval crew member stood down
item.description: The Royal Fleet Auxiliary (RFA) Tidesurge crew member was last seen at about 22:30 (local time) on Friday.
